text.tspan: The two Germanies: Planning and capitalism - GDP per
GDP per capita is measured in 1990 international dollars, which adjusts for inflation and price differences across
countries. Unit 1 'The capitalist revolutionâ€™ Section 1.9 'Capitalism, causation and history's hockey stick' in The
CORE Team, The Economy. Available at: https://tinyco.re/19372660 [Figure 1.10]
Data source: The 2015 Total Economy Database
Note: The units of measurement is '1990 international dollar'. The chart uses ratio scale. CC-BY-ND-NC
